intro: Linaria floribunda, commonly known as the clustered toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its rugged appearance. Linaria floribunda is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade conditions.
